Posts.Content: I am currently having paclitaxel, herceptin and perjeta. I am exhausted most of the time. I have had 8 of 12 to date. It is building up and getting worse. This is exactly what they told me would happen.  There are days when I just sleep of the sofa. The oncologist and the chemo nurses all say this is all normal and to be expected.
Posts.Title: herceptin and Pertuzumab

Posts.Content: I am coming to the end of weekly chemo too. It’s tough. I am exhausted all the time. You are not alone. You can do this. I have wished it would stop as well. You don’t have time to get over each round before the next is due. I wake up on chemo day and say “l don’t want to go.”  But I have to. Keep going. You will get there. The end is in sight. xx
Posts.Title: I am very tired. I have 5 more weekly chemo sessions left.

Posts.Content: I have had one. Due another in a couple of weeks. I was fine. No side effects. Apparently some do but my oncologist said most don’t. Hopefully you will be fine. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Anyone had a Zoledronic Acid Infusion???

Posts.Content: Hi Lolo We are on very similar journeys it would seem.  I didn't get the F part of FEC.  Hope it wasn't too bad.  From what I have read on this site people seem to either get docetaxel or paclitaxel.  I don't know how they decide which one.  I have Petuzumab tomorrow (Wednesday) then paclitaxel and herceptin on Thursday.  Apparently they give them separately the first time and if there is no adverse reaction I will have them at the same time in future.  Do you have the same?  Similarly, I have no idea how the next two day's worth of chemo will go but am hoping that the weekly doses will be easier than the EC was.  I have lost my hair as well.  I cold capped for the first two cycles but it still fell out and by the third cycle the nurses said I couldn't cold cap as I would get ice burns on my scalp.  So it's wigs and hats now. I went out for afternoon tea on Sunday for my sister-in-law's birthday.  I wore my wig and got so hot I felt positively unwell.  Back to sunhats or lightweight caps for me now. Good luck for tomorrow.  We can do this. Sandy
Posts.Title: EC

Posts.Content: A positive note of encouragement for anyone currently going through EC. I have just completed 4 rounds of EC and had my mid way MRI before the next stage of my treatment, which will be 12 x weekly paclitaxel with three weekly herceptin and petuzumab.  I am having chemo before surgery as I have multi focal grade 3 Her2 +++ and ER+ tumours. Yesterday my oncologist sent me an email confirming that the EC has given me a complete response.  "Complete disappearance of the cancer in the breast and lymph node." Obviously this is wonderful news for me, but the reason I am posting this is to offer hope and encouragement to anyone else currently struggling through EC.  It does work and it is worth it. I had a hard time with EC.  I was hospitalised with neutropenia twice, and then the C part of the EC was reduced by 20% for the last two cycles.  I felt like I was going for a full set of side effects and there were times when I was reduced to tears and wanted to give up.  So stick with it if you are struggling through.  I still have the next 12 weeks chemo to get through, then mastectomy and radiotherapy so I am nowhere near home and dry buy it is very heartening to get good news along the way. Good luck everybody on this awful journey. Sandy
Posts.Title: EC

Posts.Content: Hi. I am starting chemo 2nd May. First time. Grade 3. HER2 positive. Looks like both breasts although original diagnosis was just one. We can do this. 6 month chemo then mastectomy then radiotherapy for me. I am aiming to be done for Christmas. It’s going to be a rough year for sure. Good luck to you. It’s going to be a rough ride I suspect but there is light at the end of that long tunnel. Sandy xxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed triple negative starting Chemo 1st May

Posts.Content: Thank you. I am partway through treatment and really struggling at today so it was good to read this. X
Posts.Title: There Is life after treatment finishes

Posts.Content: I had my first one a couple of weeks ago alongside paclitaxel . Was warned about flu symptoms but I didn’t have any. I am to have one more before surgery then will have six monthly for three years. So I guess it’s like all this chemo stuff, side effects are different for everyone.  I should add too that on EC I tried for a full set of side eland have had my share on paclitaxel too, so I am not immune to them normally!
Posts.Title: Zoledronic acid ( Bisphosphonate )

Posts.Content: Hi Betty. What a gorgeous puppy. Thank you for sharing. Is he /she a Cavoodle?  Looks very similar to my baby who I just lost after 13 years together. His timing couldn’t have been any worse. He went to heaven in the second week of my first chemo cycle and I was heartbroken. I miss him. I hope you have many many happy years with this little one. Good luck on this horrible journey. Sandy x
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi Georgia. Sorry to hear this and especially so as it was dropped on you after all the other stuff. I had chemo first, followed by DMX and radiotherapy. I wouldn’t insult you by pretending chemo is easy. It was tough for me. But it passed and now it’s over, as it will be for you. It works. It killed all my cancer. I would advise writing off the time you will be in chemo but looking ahead to better times. It passes and then it’s over. Listen to your body and rest as much as you can. And you don’t yet know, but you might be one of the lucky people who sail through it with minimal side effects. You can do this. Be kind to yourself and very good luck. xxx
Posts.Title: About to start my chemo journey

Posts.Content: You are right.  It’s not right.  It’s disgusting. xx
Posts.Title: Rant alert - feel free to ignore :-)

Posts.Content: I had 4xEC followed by 12x paclitaxel. I had scan after fourth Ec which was half way through my plan.
Posts.Title: Scans - neoadjuvant chemo

Posts.Content: That’s interesting about your hip Rosie.  I too have one very bad hip now. It has been scanned and diagnosed as arthritis but it developed during chemo, which included herceptin.  It would be wonderful if it came right after I finish herceptin. It hadn’t occurred to me that that could be causing it.
Posts.Title: Side effects on Herceptin

Posts.Content: I am due herceptin 12 of 18 on Wednesday.  It is nowhere near as tough as chemo. Not even in the same ballpark! I get a bloated windy gut and a close relationship with the bathroom for a few days, indigestion, bit of an itchy rash on my forearms, and runny nose and eyes.  I am getting joint pain but I am also on letrazole so I suspect that may not be the herceptin.  I do get a bit of a headache but nothing a couple of paracetamol won’t fix. I won’t be sorry when number 18 is over, but it really isn’t anywhere near as bad as chemo.  Best of luck.  xx
Posts.Title: Side effects on Herceptin

Posts.Content: I am on herceptin and often get headaches. I think they are one of the listed side effects of herceptin. xx
Posts.Title: CT scan for brain mets

Posts.Content: I am on paclitaxel herceptin and perjeta which I believe is similar. My oncologist told me it’s ok to have a glass of wine when I feel well enough. I have enjoyed the odd glass although I have notic that I can’t drink very much these days. One is enough! Happy Birthday
Posts.Title: Big birthday

Posts.Content: Hi Lynne i have had my first one of these. I had a tiny bit of swelling in my fingers but only for a day and it was not bad enough to describe it as painful. No flu symptoms or any other nasties. Hopefully you will be fine too.  Sandy
Posts.Title: Starting Zolendronate

Posts.Content: R1 R2 was excellent for me. You can buy on line or get it on prescription from GP.
Posts.Title: Advice on which moisturiser to use during radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I am on paclitaxel too and my nose keeps running. Sometimes it’s blood and sometimes it’s just clear. The oncologist has said that it is a normal side effect.
Posts.Title: Nose bleed

Posts.Content: I used the R1 and R2 creams especially made for radiotherapy. GP can prescribe them, or you can buy them on line. The radiotherapy unit didn’t seem to know much about them but I heard about them on this website and read up on the studies. I really do believe they worked for me. I got tight skin but put lots of R2 on 4 times a day, plus R1 immediately after treatment. I had no skin breakdown at all.  I would recommend them. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Can anyone advise which creams are best for moisturising after radiotherapy...

Posts.Content: I had chemo, mx then radiotherapy to chest wall and collarbone. Boost was never mentioned. xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy...no boost doses

Posts.Content: I had double mastectomy with right node clearance on Wednesday 21.11.18. Thee drains were removed five days later even though one was still draining 90 mls per day.  I saw the surgeon for dressing removal last Friday and had developed large seromas with painful swelling. He had these drained. 240ml on one side, 30 mls on the other. The next day the swelling was back and now, two days later I would estimate it’s as big as before.  Has anyone else had this please and if so how did you manage it and how long did it go on for?  It is getting me down.  Any advice please Sandy
Posts.Title: Post MX seromai pain
